content.question: A particle moves along the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis so that at time <math alttext="t is greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> its position is given by <math alttext="y of t, equals, two thirds times t cubed, minus 5 times t squared, plus 8, t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Over the time interval <math alttext="0 is less than t, which is less than 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, for what values of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the speed of the particle increasing?

choices.label: <math alttext="2.5 is less than t, which is less than 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2.5</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></math>
<math alttext="4 is less than t, which is less than 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></math> only

<math alttext="0 is less than t, which is less than 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> and <math alttext="4 is less than t, which is less than 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1 is less than t, which is less than 2.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="4 is less than t, which is less than 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1 is less than t, which is less than 2.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="4 is less than t, which is less than 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo><</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
